title: Fig Balsamic Chicken Breast with Pan Sauce
directions: Whisk together fig balsamic vinegar, olive oil, honey, soy sauce, garlic, thyme, Dijon mustard (if using), and black pepper in a bowl.
Reserve 1/3 of the marinade (about 3 tbsp) in a separate container for the pan sauce -- do not let this touch raw chicken.
Pour remaining marinade over chicken breasts in a bowl or bag. Marinate for 30 minutes to 2 hours in the fridge (up to 8 hours for maximum flavor).
Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry for a better sear.
Cook chicken by your preferred method (pan-sear, grill, or oven bake) until internal temperature reaches 165F.
For the sauce: in the same skillet or a saucepan, pour in reserved marinade with a splash of water or white wine (about 2 tbsp).
Bring to a simmer and cook 2-4 minutes until slightly thickened.
Optionally whisk in 1 tsp butter at the end for a glossy finish.
Drizzle sauce over sliced chicken or rice.
notes: The key technique is reserving 1/3 of the marinade before it touches raw chicken so it can be safely used as a sauce. Pairs well with oven-roasted zucchini and squash, and roasted red potatoes. Pat chicken dry before cooking for the best sear.
